thread.title: Lord Rose, former head of Marks and Spencer, to lead pro-EU campaign
thread.title_full: Lord Rose, former head of Marks and Spencer, to lead pro-EU campaign

author: Steven Swinford
title: Lord Rose, former head of Marks and Spencer, to lead pro-EU campaign
text:
EU Referendum Lord Rose, former head of Marks and Spencer, to lead pro-EU campaign The campaign for Britain to stay in the EU will on Monday unveil Lord Rose, Peter Mandelson and Danny Alexander as its leading figures Former Marks & Spencer chairman Lord Rose Photo: Paul Grover By Steven Swinford , Deputy Political Editor 10:00PM BST 09 Oct 2015 Follow 
Lord Rose, the former head of Marks and Spencer, will lead the campaign to keep Britain in the European Union after warning that leaving would "risk our prosperity, threaten our safety and diminish our influence" in the world. 
The peer will be announced as chairman of the In Campaign at its relaunch on Monday after an alliance of Tory donors, business leaders and senior figures from across the political spectrum said that they would campaign for Britain to leave the EU. 
The group will also unveil the members of its board including Lord Mandelson, the architect of New Labour, and Danny Alexander, the Liberal Democrat and former Chief Secretary to the Treasury. 
Lord Rose's intervention will fuel concerns that the "in" campaign will use similar tactics to those used by those who warned against the break up of the union during the Scottish referendum. 
Senior politicians repeatedly warned that an independent Scotland would have profound economic and social consequences. 
Lord Rose said: â€œMost people, myself included, will make a hard-headed, practical calculation in the coming referendum on what is best for the British people. 
"I believe that Britain is stronger in Europe. The choice in the coming referendum is between remaining stronger, safer and better off inside Europe, or taking a leap into the unknown, risking our prosperity, threatening our safety, and diminishing our influence in the world.
